channel.title: Why do you listen to music?
channel.description: Do you listen to music in order to help you study? Do you listen to music while doing chores? Do you listen to music when you're in a certain mood? Why do you listen to music?

item.title: Why do you listen to music?
item.dc:creator: Tropical_Madman
item.description:
Yes, yes, and yes.

The reason I usually listen to music is to just a get away from other people. Like auguring or fighting. It really helps bring the mood.

My dad and uncle usually fight when they see each other so I just kind of plug in my headphones, go outside, and just sit and stare at the sky.

Also videos games mostly bring me peace. Just playing games makes me feel unstressed and relieved.

But any-who, that was the reason I mostly listen to music.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do you listen to music?

item.title: Why do you listen to music?
item.dc:creator: enby
item.description:
Making music helps me express or work out what I’m feeling. I relate a lot to what you’re saying there.

item.title: Why do you listen to music?
item.dc:creator: Bassment_Chemists
item.description:
I listen to music in hopes of being moved…i call it the God note, you know when you hear a song and the hairs on the back of your neck raise up? When the artist emotes their soul so perfectly that it touches your soul and you connect on that other level? That my friends is why I listen to music.
#insearchofthegodnote

Read full topic

item.title: Why do you listen to music?
item.dc:creator: enby
item.description:
Nice! It’s pretty much the same for me too. Though, I also listen to songs in order to explore genres I haven’t tried. Making music has changed how I view music as well; I also listen to Auxy music in order to see what the community is up to.

Read full topic
